articles.author: Samia Nakhoul, James Mackenzie
articles.description: Donald Trump's Middle East tour had a clear message for Benjamin Netanyahu: In Trump's vision of Middle East diplomacy, the Israeli prime minister could no longer count on unconditional US support for his right-wing agenda.
articles.title: Trump's Gulf tour reshapes Middle East diplomatic map

articles.author: Pavel Polityuk, Gleb Garanich, Valentyn Ogirenko
articles.description: The largest known Russian drone attack since full-scale war began in 2022 killed a woman in the Kyiv region and injured at least three people, Ukrainian authorities said early on Sunday, as Moscow stepped up strikes following peace talks on Friday.
articles.title: Russia launches war's largest drone attack after peace talks, Ukraine says

articles.author: Andrius Sytas
articles.description: Russia detained a Greek-owned oil tanker on Sunday after it left an Estonian Baltic Sea port, the Estonian Foreign Ministry said, adding that it had alerted NATO allies to the incident.
articles.title: Estonia says Russia detained a tanker in Baltic Sea

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: An Israeli airstrike killed at least 24 Palestinians in a tent encampment housing displaced families in Khan Younis in the southern Gaza Strip, local health authorities said on Sunday, as mediators hosted a new round of talks between Israel and Hamas.
articles.title: Israel airstrike kills at least 24 in Gaza as mediators host ceasefire talks

articles.author: Joshua McElwee, Crispian Balmer
articles.description: Crowds are expected to cram St. Peter's Square and surrounding streets in Rome for the formal celebration, which includes Leo's first ride in the white popemobile.
articles.title: Pope Leo to take charge of Catholic Church at grandiose inaugural Mass

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Any deal between the United States and Iran must include an agreement not to enrich uranium, U.S. special envoy Steve Witkoff said on Sunday, a comment that drew criticism from Tehran.
articles.title: Trump envoy Witkoff cites US 'red line' with Iran against uranium enrichment

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney said on Sunday the federal government will present a budget in the autumn, days after the finance minister had said the new Liberal government will have an economic update later in the year.
articles.title: Canada PM Carney says federal budget will come in the autumn

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: U.S. Vice President JD Vance met European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen and Italian Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni on Sunday, and said he hoped their encounter would help move forward trade talks between the EU and the United States.
articles.title: U.S. vice president meets EU Commission chief, hopes to move forward trade talks

articles.author: Catarina Demony, Sergio Goncalves
articles.description: It's the third parliamentary election in as many years, and people are bracing for more uncertainty as the vote is unlikely to deliver a stable government.
articles.title: Portuguese vote in election unlikely to yield stable government

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A blast at police station in eastern Syria's Al-Mayadeen town on Sunday has led to casualties, the state news agency said, citing a security source.
articles.title: Blast at police station in eastern Syria leads to casualties, state news agency says
